intro: Datura coccinea, commonly known as the red morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and parts of Mexico. It is a herbaceous annual that produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers in shades of red, pink, and white. The plant has large, heart-shaped leaves and is known for its rapid growth and ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions. Its flowers open in the morning and close by midday, hence its common name. Datura coccinea contains toxic alkaloids and should be handled with care.
